text: Monique Pariseau (born 1948) is a Canadian writer and educator living in Quebec. She was born in Quebec City, Quebec, and grew up there and in Saint- Vallier. From 1983 to 1985, she taught at Safi, Morocco. She went on to teach French and literature at the Cégep de Saint-Jérôme, settling in Saint- Hippolyte. She retired from teaching in 2009. Her first novel Les Figues de Barbarie, set in Morocco and published in 1990, finished second in the Prix Robert-Cliche competition for 1990. Her novel Le Secret was a finalist for the Prix Elle-Québec. She received second prize for her story "Brin de nid" in the Prix littéraires de Radio-Canada. == Selected works == * Objets de mémoires, stories (1997) * La Fiancée du vent, novel (2003) * Jeanne Barret, novel (2010) == References == Category:1948 births Category:Living people Category:Canadian women novelists Category:Writers from Quebec City
title: Monique Pariseau
